The premise is: "If the doll was plastic, then the truck was metal."
The conclusion is: "If the truck was metal, then the doll was plastic."

The logical form of the argument can be represented as:
Premise: P → Q
Conclusion: Q → P

This form of argument is known as the "converse" of the original implication.

To determine the validity of this argument, we need to consider the truth table for the implication (→) operation.

The truth table for the implication (→) operation is as follows:

P | Q | P → Q
--+--+------

T | F |   F
F | T |   T
F | F |   T
